body.p:
Bowling Green Ky April 2nd 1861.
His Excellency
Gov. Mcgoffin
Dr. Sir
I understand that efforts are being made to obtain executive clemency in behalf of HenryRufus Jones convicted of manslaughter & Sent from this County to the Penetentairy for five years

At the time the murder occured the act was properly called but by delays in court putting of trial & maneuvering to have an accomplice tried Seperately & cleared; the testimony desired was obtained & by these means no doubt Jones was saved from capital punishment and Since he has been So lienently dealt with by law I, and almost every man I have heard express an opinion think that the young blood Should be Suffered to cool & that he Should not be turned loose upon the community to again perpetrate Some desperate action to be again releaved of punishment designated by the law for Such crimes by the money & influence of his rich Kin, I most Earnestly petition you to give Jones a trade for the full time he was Sentanced for, that he may have the ability to Support himself & have an occupation, the lack of which, may have lead him into disipated company & assosiated him with desperate men who think it brave to violate the laws of the land & brag that they have Killed their man Hoping that you ^may^ think it proper in this case that the laws be executed According to the Sentence I remain very Respy your frd & Obt svt

His Excellency
Gov B Mcgoffin
Frankfort
Ky
